item.title: Veg_Ninja_Swipe_Demo
item.description: This game is designed for mobile devices and demonstrates touch controls and swiping.

item.title: Angry_Cats_Physics_Demo
item.description: This fun demo illustrates the ease with which you can use GameMaker: Studio to re-create a well known game. Shows basic physics as well as touch controls.

item.title: Angry_Cats_Space_Demo
item.description: This version of Angry Cats adds to the original, showing how to make gravity a part of the game.

item.title: Asynchronous_Events_Example
item.description: In this basic demo you can see how to use the asynchronous events to load images into GameMaker: Studio

item.title: HTML5_Custom_Loading_Bar
item.description: This HTML5 only demo shows how to use a simple JavaScript extension to create a custom loading bar for your game

item.title: Tile_Based_Platformer
item.description: In this demo you can see how to create a very basic platformer using tile maps for collisions instead of more traditional methods.

item.title: Windows_8_Functions_Demo
item.description: This Windows 8 (JS and Native) only demo is designed to show you how to get the most out of the unique functions that the platform offers.

item.title: Card_Control_Demo
item.description: When making card games it can often be complicated to get the positioning and selection of overlapping cards correct and this demo shows one way in which you can do it.

item.title: Depth_Ordered_Starfield
item.description: Here we show you how to create a starfield effect where the individual "stars" have been ordered by depth. Note that this is a VERY intensive demo and a good performance benchmark.

item.title: Generic_Extensions_Demo
item.description: This demo contains examples of GML extensions, Windows DLL extensions, and iOS/Android extensions to help get you started creating your own.

item.title: High_Polygon_3D_Model
item.description: In this demo you can see how GameMaker: Studio deals with 3D and models.

item.title: HTML5_Multi_Canvas_Example
item.description: This demo is for the HTML5 target only and shows how to use multiple canvas elements by mapping them to surfaces, thus enabling non-standard shapes for displaying your game.

item.title: Isometric_Demo
item.description: This demo shows how to create a simple isometric game. Includes how a level is created, rendered, and how objects are moved and rendered into the scene correctly.

item.title: LAN_Platformer
item.description: This demo is based on the Platformer Demo, only now it permits you to connect various users in the same game. Useful to see how a basic local network can be set up.

item.title: Physics_Joints_Demo
item.description: This demo shows various examples of physics joints being created and used in a single room.

item.title: Simple_Shader_Examples
item.description: In this demo you can find multiple examples of simple shaders that can be directly integrated into your games.

item.title: Transition_Demo
item.description: The demo shows off some simple transition effects achieved using the application_surface

item.title: Window_Dragging
item.description: This demo shows how to control the window dragging and resizing directly so that the game does not pause while the window is being moved.

item.title: Ad_Colony
item.description: 18/10/2016 - An introduction to using this ad provider on Android and iOS. See the readme in Included Files!

item.title: Amazon_Game_Circle
item.description: 18/05/2017 - Amazon Game Circle demo for Amazon Fire and Google Android devices. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: Facebook
item.description: 27/09/2016 - Facebook demo for Android and iOS. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: Flurry_Analytics
item.description: 27/09/2016 - Flurry Analytics demo for Android and iOS. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: Google_Analytics
item.description: 27/09/2016 - Google Analytics demo for Android and iOS. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: Google_Mobile_Ads
item.description: 18/10/2016 - An introduction to using this ad provider on Android (v9.6.1) and iOS (v7.10.1). Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project - note requirement to use test account details now!

item.title: Google_Play_Services
item.description: 18/10/2016 - Google Play Services demo for Android (v9.6.1) and iOS (v7.10.1). Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: MMedia
item.description: 18/10/2016 - An introduction to using this ad provider on Android and iOS. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project. NOTE: This is not updated to match "ONE by AOL" version.

item.title: Moga
item.description: 27/09/2016 - Moga pad demo for Android. Test out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: MoPub
item.description: 18/10/2016 - An introduction to using this ad provider on Android and iOS. Test your settings out, and then export the extension as a .gmez and import it into your own project.

item.title: Coding_BreakOut
item.description: This demo is the final version of the tutorial with the same name. You can use this to compare what you have done after finishing the tutorial with how it should be.

item.title: My_First_Game
item.description: This demo is the final version of the tutorial with the same name. You can use this to compare what you have done after finishing the tutorial with how it should be.

item.title: HTML5_Scaling_Demo
item.description: This demo is for the HTML5 and JS targets only and is the final version of the tutorial with the same name. You can use this to compare what you have done after finishing the tutorial with how it should be.

item.title: Optimise_Draw_Pipeline
item.description: This demo is the final version of the tutorial with the same name. You can use this to compare what you have done after finishing the tutorial with how it should be.
